p: Only turmeric displayed a moderate antioxidant activity with 24.99 ± 0.44 µL/mL, while the remaining EOs (fennel, lavender, palmarosa, pepper, star anise, and tea tree) revealed poor antioxidant activity, as reported in Table 4. Overall, clove exhibited the highest antioxidant activity amongst the EOs studied, followed by Chinese yin yang, oregano, and ylang ylang.
